properties.description: This wine leaps out of the glass with aromas of peach, wet stone, lime and high-toned flowers. The palate drinks off dry, with vibrant stone-fruit and floral flavors that linger on the finish.

properties.title: Macari 2015 Katherine's Field Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)
properties.address: 150 Bergen Ave, Mattituck, NY 11952, USA
properties.description: Bigger, bolder swathes of fresh grapefruit, gooseberry and citrus distinguish the Katherine's Field from it's sister bottling, the Life Force. Fermented in stainless steel, it's a more primary, forward expression of fruit but with an equally refreshing backbone of acidity. Hints of dusty oyster shell and lime pith lend nuance to the finish. Drink now through 2019.

properties.title: Toad Hollow 2015 Francine's Selection Unoaked Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
properties.description: Bright citrus and green-apple flavors lift this wine above the usual butterballs in terms of freshness and lively texture. It is medium bodied, clean and appetizing.

properties.title: Snoqualmie 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.description: The vanilla, cranberry, cherry and licorice aromas are elegant and light but seem ever so slightly dried out. Blackberry flavors stretch-out on the finish, with lightly dry tannins backing them up.

properties.title: Swiftwater Cellars 2015 Zephyr Ridge Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Horse Heaven Hills)
properties.address: 301 Rope Rider Dr, Cle Elum, WA 98922, USA
properties.description: Reserved aromas of baked apple, cream and spice lead to medium-bodied and tart lemony flavors that stretch-out on the finish. It shows a pleasing sense of balance.

properties.title: Domaine Chenevières 2015 Les Grandes Vignes  (Chablis)
properties.address: 230 Rte d'Azé, 71260 Saint-Maurice-de-Satonnay, France
properties.description: This domaine is now sold through the Jean-Marc Brocard family. This is a rich wine with yellow fruit as well as crisper citrus. There is a touch of pepper that lifts the fine acidity and the ripe apple and peach. At the end, the wine is crisp and clean.

properties.title: Fox Run 2012 Riesling 11 Lake Dana Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)
properties.description: A favorite within Fox Run's unique geology wine series, an exploration of specific vineyard terroir against specific vinification styles, the 11 Lake Dana Vineyard offers a lovely balance between rustic earth elements and more pristine expressions of fruit and flower. Concentrated tangerine and lemon flavors are honeyed and sweet yet elegantly balanced by tones of black tea, blossom and smoked nut. The finish lingers on a pleasantly astringent note.

properties.title: Olivier Leflaive 2014 Les Cloux Premier Cru  (Rully)
properties.description: This wine from the Côte Chalonnaise is a lighter style of Chardonnay than Leflaive's rich Côte de Beaune wines. It's a delicious lightly toasty wine that has crisp acidity and a strong and refreshing dose of lemon juice. The wine is creamy at the end. It will be ready to drink from 2017.

properties.title: Atwater 2013 Blanc de Blancs Méthode Champenoise Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)
properties.address: 5055 NY-414, Burdett, NY 14818, USA
properties.description: Cutting, fresh apple, lemon and lime reverberate throughout this zesty Chardonnay sparkling wine. The palate is exceptionally fine in texture with a softly mouth-filling mousse. The finish is tinged by a pleasant swathe of green herbs and lime zest.

properties.title: Vignerons de Buxy 2014 Les Chaniots Premier Cru  (Montagny)
properties.address: 4-6 Rte de Chalon, 71390 Buxy, France
properties.description: This wood-aged wine is rich, spicy and with a stylish combination of acidity and rich yellow and white fruits. The acidity cuts through the ripe texture and gives the wine its full-bodied character. The aftertaste shows a wine that is still young and will be best from 2018.

properties.title: Brian Carter Cellars 2014 Oriana White (Yakima Valley)
properties.address: 17311 135th Ave NE STE A450, Woodinville, WA 98072, USA
properties.description: A unique blend of Viognier (50%), Roussanne (41%) and Riesling, this wine offers light notes of peach and pear. The palate is full of stone-fruit flavors backed by vibrant acidity that piques the interest.

properties.title: Ventana 2011 Le Mistral Red (Monterey County)
properties.address: 38740 Los Coches Rd, Soledad, CA 93960, USA
properties.description: Coming in an oddly shaped, presumably old-style bottle, this blend of 51% Syrah, 39% Grenache, 7% Alicante Bouschet and 3% Petite Sirah packs a deep, rich nose full of blueberry syrup, vanilla and nutmeg, almost approaching brandy. Framed by a solid tannic structure, flavors hover on cola and cherries before hitting the spearmint-powered finish.

properties.title: Zepaltas 2012 Charles Heintz Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
properties.description: This wine pushes the limits of what is commonly thought of as California Chardonnay. It's refreshingly brisk in light, citrusy quince and razor-sharp minerality. Vibrant, it showcases the site well, coaxing crystal clarity to complex layers of ginger-specked apple and pear.

properties.title: Owen Roe 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)
properties.address: 309 Gangl Rd, Wapato, WA 98951, USA
properties.description: A blend of Red Willow, Mercer, DuBrul, Outlook and Elerding vineyards and aged in just 35% new French oak, this wine is still quite locked up with notes of herbs, plum, high-toned barrel spices and pencil lead. It brings soft, lively blue fruit flavors with the tannins combed to a fine sheen.

properties.title: Syncline 2012 Cuvée Elena Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.description: Equal parts Mourvèdre and Grenache finished with 10% Syrah, this ripe wine offers aromas of dried herbs, coffee and candied red fruit. It's rich and layered with abundant cherry flavors that lead to a light squeeze of tannins that hold on through the fruit-filled finish.

properties.title: Alcance 2014 Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Maule Valley)
properties.description: Berry, raw oak and graphite aromas lead to a rock-hard drying palate with fierce tannins. This tastes of oaky salty plum and berry, while a woody finish is overtly tannic and borderline abrasive.

properties.title: Sawtooth 2013 Estate Grown Chardonnay
properties.description: Aromas of butter, pear and pineapple are followed by a somewhat lightweight but still flavorful palate. Tropical flavors linger on the finish. The concentration doesn't all seem there but what is provides plenty of interest.

properties.title: Sawtooth 2015 Pinot Gris
properties.address: 19348 Lowell Rd Building C, Caldwell, ID 83607, USA
properties.description: The pear, apple and apple skin aromas are light. The palate brings just off-dry pear flavors with a full feel.

properties.title: Layer Cake 2015 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
properties.description: Lemon rind, orange juice and chalk show on the nose of this bottling, which is a tad simple but very quaffable. Lemon wedge, green and yellow apples, and a bit of citrus pith show on the sip.

properties.title: Liberty Lake 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
properties.address: 23110 E Knox Ave, Liberty Lake, WA 99019, USA
properties.description: The aromas are subdued, with notes of spice, mineral and black fruit. The palate is reserved in style, supported by a frame of firm somewhat gruff tannins.

properties.title: Malibu Rocky Oaks 2014 Collective 10 Year Anniversary Lot 1 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
properties.address: Rocky Oaks Park, 107 Kanan Dume Rd, Malibu, CA 90265, USA
properties.description: Baked red cherry and strawberry scents meet with touches of soy, nori and crushed rock on the nose of this bottling. Lots of peppery spice shows on the palate, though blackberry-pie flavors are sweeter than expected.

properties.title: Alyris 2014 The Audition Chardonnay (Carneros)
properties.address: 7335 CA-12, Kenwood, CA 95409, USA
properties.description: Butter and honey make for a rich, hedonistic tone to this mildly structured white. A soft, malleable texture provides creaminess without complexity.

properties.title: Boomtown 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.address: 200 Main St # B, Downieville, CA 95936, USA
properties.description: Blue and red-fruit aromas lead to lightly styled cherry flavors. Herb accents run throughout.

properties.title: Valdivieso 2015 Valley Selection Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)
properties.description: Crisp aromas veer towards fresh bell pepper and tangerine peel. This feels minerally but also like extracted grape skins. Mixed citrus and green-herb flavors end with a stony lasting feel.

properties.title: Broken Earth 2015 Vermentino (Paso Robles)
properties.address: 1650 Ramada Dr, Paso Robles, CA 93446, USA
properties.description: Light aromas of squeezed lime and sliced Anjou pear emerge on the nose of this bottling from a large vineyard on the eastern flanks of the region. The palate is tight and bright if quite restrained, with thinly sliced lime and a chalky grip. The wine would be refreshing in warm weather.

properties.title: Carpineto 2015 Farnito Chardonnay (Toscana)
properties.address: SP 16 Chianti-Valdarno, 50022 Greve FI, Italy
properties.description: Aromas of oak, toast and a whiff of mature yellow apple skin lead the nose. The aromas carry over to the subdued palate along with a note of candied nectarine zest. A note of bitter walnut marks the close.

properties.title: Prieler 2016 Ried Seeberg Pinot Blanc (Burgenland)
properties.address: Hauptstraße 181, 7081 Schützen am Gebirge, Austria
properties.description: A faint touch of hazelnut plays on the lemon aromas of the nose. The palate has a lingering combination of the two, plus a zesty, phenolic texture that has slight but pleasantly bitter edges plus more fruit, akin to ripe, yellow apple. This is a rounded Pinot Blanc with potential. Drink now–2022.

properties.title: Rôtie Cellars 2015 Northern Blend Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
properties.description: With 94% Syrah and 6% Viognier and coming from the Rocks District, this wine brings aromatically expressive aromas of green olive, fresh violet, sea salt, black pepper, orange peel and earthy funk. The palate is soft and silky in feel, showing an appealing sense of balance and restraint. It delivers a sense of elegance.

properties.title: Schloss Gobelsburg 2016 Ried Steinsetz Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
properties.address: Schloss Str. 16, 3550, Austria
properties.description: Fresh lime and ivy hits you first, followed by a leesy hint and some pear on the nose. The palate comes in with salty savoriness that suggests yeasty miso, chervil and lovage, with lots of white pepper accented by a little spritz. Brightened by fresh lemon notes, this makes for a spicy, elegant and slender wine with a light touch and real depth.

properties.title: Shared Notes 2015 Les Pierres Qui Decident Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
properties.address: 78 Swartout Rd, Manson, WA 98831, USA
properties.description: Inspired by the Loire Valley, where the “rocks decide” (as this bottling's name suggests), this wine is very light and almost cloudy in color, and shows tons of chalk, wet wool, lime peel and seashore on the nose. The texture is immensely intriguing, presenting flavors of just-ripe Anjou pear, cut grass, and iodine-like kelp tones, with a flash of petrol on the finish.

properties.title: Stift Klosterneuburg 2016 Zierfandler-Rotgipfler (Thermenregion)
properties.address: Rathauspl. 24, 3400 Klosterneuburg, Austria
properties.description: Aromatic notions of summer blossom and freshly cut pear appear on the nose. The palate brings out ripe, rounded and juicy pear notes alongside a textured, slightly phenolic midpalate that adds backbone. Rounded with rich fruit, it has a briskly clean finish.

properties.title: Strauss 2016 Ried Gamlitzberg Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)
properties.address: Steinbach 16, 8462 Gamlitz, Austria
properties.description: A touch of peach is edged with leafy notes of citrus foliage and a touch of elderflower. The palate brings out the peach but also a zestiness reminiscent of grapefruit peel, making for a crisp texture. Full of flavor this has a rounded midpalate despite the slender body.

properties.title: Weszeli 2016 Besse Fleur Riesling (Weinland Österreich)
properties.description: The bright, tart flesh of early-season apples tingles enticingly on the nose. The palate follows with tart sweetness, mimicking the sweet but refreshing crunch of a ripe but tart apple. The body is delicate, with a balance that teeters between sweet and tart. Totally refreshing, it finishes with lasting echoes of apple.

properties.title: Domaine Corne-Loup 2016  Tavel
properties.description: Round and harmonious on the palate, this wine is a terrific value. Floral notes mark the nose, backed up by raspberry and strawberry fruit, while an undercurrent of crushed stone provides depth and backbone. The finish is berry-filled, but balanced and savory.

properties.title: Robert Mondavi 2015 Reserve To Kalon Vineyard Fumé Blanc (Napa Valley)
properties.description: From an historic block of the famous vineyard long known as Robert's Block, this white is incredibly complex and concentrated, with richly woven layers of pear, Key lime and peach. A handful of Sémillon is blended in, adding extra oomph and flavor, the finish balanced in acidity and marked by freshness.

properties.title: Morell-Peña 2015 Ysabella Bjork Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.description: Aromas of pear, lees and tropical fruit lead to a rich flavorful palate, absolutely loaded with tropical-fruit flavors that show a delightful sense of balance. The oak usage (25% new French) is judicious, allowing the fruit to shine.

properties.title: Neumeister 2016 Steirische Klassik Gelber Muskateller
properties.description: A lively whiff of white blossom, Muscat grapes and lemon enticingly streaks the nose. These flavors continue on a feather-light and dry palate where fresh acidity makes them shine even brighter. This wine is all about expressing the most delicious, dry but totally aromatic lightness. Refreshing and made for summer, it has an irresistible lemon finish.

properties.title: Pierre Henri Morel 2014 White (Laudun)
properties.address: 1355 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA
properties.description: Full bodied and opulent, yet remarkably refreshing at the same time, wines like this are why the commune of Laudun is so highly regarded as a white-wine terroir within the warm Southern Rhône. Honey, pineapple and stone fruit notes linger through the finish, balanced by hints of crushed stone and citrus. Drink now.

properties.title: Tablas Creek 2014 Esprit de Tablas Grown and Bottled on the Estate Mourvèdre-Grenache-Syrah-Counoise Red (Adelaida District)
properties.description: An elegantly integrated dark-red-cherry component distinguishes the nose of this blend of 40% Mourvèdre, 35% Grenache, 20% Syrah and 5% Counoise, with hints of sagebrush and baking spice. The food-friendly palate combines dark-berry flavors with dried herbs, graphite and light sarsaparilla, with well-integrated acidity and a silky yet firm texture.

properties.title: Tegernseerhof 2016 Terrassen Federspiel Riesling (Wachau)
properties.description: A touch of lemon zest, a hint of lime, a suspicion of yeast: the nose of this wine is fresh and restrained. Light but juicy, the body ripples with refreshing ease across the tongue. It's a slender, pure and uplifting wine with zestiness and enduring, almost-weightless freshness.

properties.title: Terre Rouge 2016 Vin Gris d'Amour Rosé (Sierra Foothills)
properties.description: Pretty and pink, this light-bodied but nervy wine brims with white raspberry and pomegranate flavors and a texture that is crisp and mouth-cleansing. The balance between fruitiness and acidity is precise and appetizing, so it pays off sip after sip. It was made from Grenache, Mourvèdre, Roussanne and Grenache Blanc.

properties.title: Kale 2016 McGah Vineyard Rosé (Rutherford)
properties.address: 708 1st St, Napa, CA 94559, USA
properties.description: From the eastern side of the Napa Valley, this combines 84% Grenache with 16% Mourvèdre, harvesting the best clusters of the grapes specifically for this light, dry wine. The juice is left to ferment and rest in concrete egg and neutral French oak. Light-copper in color, it's perfumed in jasmine, with accents of white peach, lime and strawberry, light and ethereal with a backbone of focused acidity.

properties.title: L'Amandine 2011 Bel Air Red
properties.address: 480 Route de Roaix Quartier, Bélair, 84110 Seguret, France
properties.description: It's fading a bit at the rim, but it's a treat to know that mature releases like this are in the market. Age has mellowed its tannins to silky smoothness, while the aromas and flavors resemble thyme blossoms, cherries and leather. Hints of herbal tea and mocha linger elegantly on the finish. Drink now–2022.

properties.title: Pommery 1998 Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)
properties.description: A fine vintage, which shows some age from a relatively fast-maturing year, but is now nicely poised between the initial fresh green fruits and grapefruit flavors, and the elements of toast and yeast that are developing well. This is a great food wine, with some weight and ripeness.

properties.title: Volker Eisele Family Estate 2006 Gemini White Wine White (Napa Valley)
properties.description: From Chiles Valley, this blend of 71% Semillon and 29% Sauvignon Blanc is one of the best wines of its type of the vintage. Cofermented and barrel aged in 15% new French oak, it shows extraordinary richness, and savory flavors of green and yellow tree fruits, green tea, cashew, Asian spices and gingery vanilla. It even has some dusty tannins that make for grip and structure. The finish is absolutely dry.

properties.title: Masciarelli 2004 Marina Cvetic  (Trebbiano d'Abruzzo)
properties.description: This wine brings the Trebbiano grape to a whole new level of sophistication. You'll get stone fruit, melon and apricot, but you'll also be rewarded with radically unique aromas of melted butter, brown sugar and crunchy crème caramel. The texture is smooth and firm and the wine's persistency can be counted in minutes.

properties.title: Pierre Gimonnet et Fils 2002 Fleuron Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
properties.description: This recently released 2002 is still showing its youth, with a firm, mineral edge to it. But it does have the right refreshingly crisp character, along with intense fruits, and acidity that just powers right through. Wait 3–4 years.

properties.title: Arrowood 2003 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
properties.description: They kept this Cab back all this time, presumably at some cost to the company, but consumers are the beneficiaries. Everything has mellowed. The wine, with 1% Petit Verdot, is like hands of cassis, dark chocolate and oak massaging the palate. The grapes were sourced from top vineyards in the Dry Creek, Sonoma and Alexander Valleys. Drink now–2010.

properties.title: Novelty Hill 2004 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.description: A dark and spicy wine, with streaks of mineral and herb buried within very tart, acidic black fruit. This is complex, quite youthful and tightly woven. I think it will require some years to pull itself together, but the balance is here, in a medium-bodied style, showing some herb, some citrus and plenty of muscle. Tasted over many hours after being decanted, it showed itself to be a wonderful wine that developed multiple layers of flavor.

properties.title: Robert Craig 2004 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
properties.address: 1553 2nd St, Napa, CA 94559, USA
properties.description: This is a very lush Cab, made in the modern style. All the elements of cult Cab are there: the soft voluptuousness, the finely ground, sweet tannins, the immensely ripe currant, blackberry and cocoa flavors, the coating of fine, smoky oak. I don't think it's an ager because of the softness and ripeness.

properties.title: Volpe Pasini 2005 Zuc di Volpe Pinot Bianco (Colli Orientali del Friuli)
properties.description: Solid, luscious and silky smooth, this white wine from the northern Friuli region is one of the most beautiful expressions of the Pinot Bianco grape you'll find. Stone fruit and nutty tones are rich and penetrating and backed by more fruit and white flowers. Half the wine sees four months of oak to shape its creamy consistency and heightened complexity.

properties.title: Woodward Canyon 2006 Chardonnay (Washington)
properties.description: This is classic Washington Chardonnay, from the winery that first put it on the national map. It's beautifully built upon ripe apple, pineapple and kiwi fruit, with proportionate acid and lovely, lightly toasty oak. The alcohol is 14.3%, and the wine strikes a perfect note of weight and density, without being fat or fatiguing.

properties.title: Novelty Hill 2005 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Sémillon (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.description: This is just about perfect Sémillon— the gorgeous fruit has more flesh and breadth with flavors suggesting ripe fig, melon and citrus. The use of oak is judicious and thoughtful; it adds grace notes without dominating. You can't help but wonder why this grape remains such a novelty (except, ironically, at Novelty Hill!). It's seductive, delicious and unique.

properties.title: Stevens 2004 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)
properties.address: 18520 142nd Ave NE, Woodinville, WA 98072, USA
properties.description: Dark and dense, yet somehow soft and approachable, this 100% is once again loaded with rich black fruits. Everything is in balance, with a captivating tension strung between the fruit, acid and tannins. This is a wine you can't keep your lips off.

properties.title: Syzygy 2004 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.description: This is pure Cabernet from older vines, and has a meaty, herbal power to it. Streaks of tar and some lively cinnamon spice add life to the fruit, which is solid and earthy. I pick up black licorice, vanilla cream, and still more interesting flavors wrapped into the tannins, which seem dusty and smoky and a bit grainy. This has some real substance to it, and shows some of the herbal side of the grape. The best so far from SYZYGY.

properties.title: R.H. Phillips 1999 Estate Bottled Viognier (Dunnigan Hills)
properties.description: Ripe and solid, this is a thoroughly enjoyable California example of this Rhône varietal. The wine presents an enticing bouquet of tropical fruits, floral scents, vanilla, even a hint of banana. The palate is medium weight, with citrus and more vanilla flavors. Closes nicely with light spice and toasty accents.

properties.title: Io 1997 Red (Santa Barbara County)
properties.description: A blend of mainly Syrah, with Grenache, Mourvèdre and Viognier. Opens with brilliant, beautiful aromas of berries and fruit, chocolate, violets, herbs and spices, and smoky oak. In the mouth, there's fabulous complexity and an opulent, velvety smooth texture. Very dry and elegant, and the sweet, spicy finish goes on forever.

properties.title: Schug 1998 Chardonnay (Carneros)
properties.description: Defines Carneros in its rich, nuanced aromas of fig, ripe peach, tangerine, nutmeg and oaky vanilla. Winemaker-induced complexities from barrel fermentation and lees aging. Tremendous depth of flavor, it just sings on the palate and is so rich and spicy. The ultralong finish is sweet and satisfying.

properties.title: Leonetti Cellar 1997 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.description: The nose leaps out of the glass: fat, meaty and jammy, laden with ripe, seductive fruit. The palate impression is still young, firm and tight, with tart loganberry fruit that has a nice tang to it. It's all wrapped in big, toasty layers of oak, with coffee, bitter chocolate and licorice running through the long finish. This one needs more time to knit itself together and open up.

properties.title: Domaine Laroche 1997 Les Blanchots  (Chablis)
properties.address: 22 Rue Louis Bro, 89800 Chablis, France
properties.description: Very light mango, pineapple and banana aromas are joined by flowers and minerals. Nutty notes are brought to the fore on the dry and stony palate. Finishes broad and long, with echos of the floral and mineral notes on the nose. Now it's pretty tight; best in 2002 and beyond.

properties.title: Lundeen 2013 Juliard Vineyard Old Vine Riesling (Dundee Hills)
properties.description: This has compelling intensity, with the extra dimensions that vines more than four decades old can offer. The concentrated apple and pear fruit is pure, deep and lingering. The wine is finished off dry.

properties.title: Paix Sur Terre 2014 Kiler Grove Vineyard Ugni Blanc (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
properties.address: 5070 Vineyard Dr, Paso Robles, CA 93446, USA
properties.description: This rarely explored grape, also known as Trebbiano, proves quite exciting in this bottling. Aromas recall ripe lime flesh, white flowers, green apples, Asian pears and white peach, with a nearly tropical banana sap character. The palate tightens around the limey acidity, showing some ripe red apple, but remaining bright, ready to pair with everything from roast chicken to shellfish.

properties.title: Amici 2012 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
properties.address: 3130 Old Lawley Toll Rd, Calistoga, CA 94515, USA
properties.description: Floral and lush, this majority Cabernet Sauvignon contains 10% Merlot and 6% Petit Verdot, combining for a structured, layered wine accented in black cherry, cedar and dried herb. From vineyards strewn across the Napa Valley, including mountainside sites, it offers power and finesse and should sit well in cellar through 2022.

properties.title: Blakeslee 2013 Reserve Chardonnay (Chehalem Mountains)
properties.description: Rich and fruity, this reserve adds layers of spice and citrus to the peachy core of the regular bottling. Details of rind put a frame on the fruit, while a lightly toasty finish brings a lingering note of banana along for the ride.

properties.title: Domaine Cauhapé 2013 Ballet d'Octobre  (Jurançon)
properties.description: Harvested at the end of October, this gently sweet wine has hints of botrytis along with ripe apricot and honey flavors. It is shot through with delicious acidity that gives the wine a great lift and final freshness.

properties.title: Domaine Nigri 2013 Pierre de Lune  (Jurançon Sec)
properties.description: This rich and ripe wine is full of apricot and almond flavors. It is beautifully textured with a strongly mineral character as well as an orange-zest flavor and tangy, spicy aftertaste. The wine should age, so drink from 2017.

properties.title: Skouras 2013 Zoe White (Peloponnese)
properties.description: This blend of Roditis and Moscofilero offers floral, flirty aromas and a palate that's both fresh and layered. Flavors of lemon, violet and orange are rounded but balanced by lively acidity.

properties.title: St. Urbans-Hof 2012 Nik Weis Schodener Saarfeilser Marienberg Grosse Lage Riesling (Mosel)
properties.description: Decadent white floral tones persist throughout this dry, gorgeously perfumed Riesling. Concentrated white peach and apricot flavors feel plush and concentrated on the palate but zesty acidity adds a vivacious kick. Drink now through 2017.

properties.title: I Giusti e Zanza 2014 Memorino White (Toscana)
properties.description: Here's a fresh, savory white made from Trebbiano and Sémillon grapes. It opens with aromas of pineapple, exotic fruit and white wildflowers that carry over to the linear palate alongside Mediterranean herb, yellow peach and lemon zest. Tangy acidity provides balance and generates a crisp, clean finish.

properties.title: Markus Molitor 2012 Haus Klosterberg Feinherb Riesling (Mosel)
properties.description: Whiffs of sweet pastry and sun-kissed nectarines lend richness to this zesty, off-dry Riesling. Sweet and tart, it's lip smackingly juicy, finishing on a deliciously astringent lemon pith note. Drink now through 2017.

properties.title: Nessa 2014 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
properties.description: Cider and acacia aromas are subtle and inviting. This has a round yet citrusy feel along with flavors of nectarine and orange. A steady, smooth, minerally finish with just enough pulp and weight makes for a fine ending. Drink now.

properties.title: Occasio 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
properties.description: Full bodied, this is saturated with color and tannins, ripe and generous in flavor. Aromas resemble dark chocolate, blueberries and cedar shavings, while flavors run to fresh blackberry, cinnamon and clove. The texture is astringent from tannins that will stand up to rich food, and the finish is surprisingly light.

properties.title: Ponzi 2014 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
properties.address: 19500 SW Mountain Home Rd, Sherwood, OR 97140, USA
properties.description: This wine boasts a lovely, creamy texture and citrusy freshness enhanced by deep concentration. Along with the citrus you'll find apple, pear and melon fruitiness. This is an irresistible summer sipper.

properties.title: Ponzi 2014 Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)
properties.description: As sure-fire as the sunrise, Ponzi's Pinot Noir Rosé is always a class act. The floral, strawberry and peppercorn aromas set your mouth watering before the first sip. There's sufficient acidity to take a bit of a chill-down in stride, and the finish, though bone dry, has ample fruit sweetness to round out the mouthfeel.

properties.title: S.A. Prüm 2012 Wehlener Sonnenuhr Kabinett Grosse Lage Riesling (Mosel)
properties.address: Uferallee 25, 54470 Bernkastel-Kues, Germany
properties.description: Nuances of bramble and grain lend earthy complexity to this otherwise deeply fruity Riesling. Lemon-lime acidity pierces the midpalate, cutting through layers of ripe yellow-cherry and even berry flavors. The finish is lip smackingly sweet. Drink now.

properties.title: Schug 2013 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
properties.address: Schug Carneros Estate Winery, 602 Bonneau Rd, Sonoma, CA 95476, USA
properties.description: Wet stone and a chalky underbelly of crisp, clean and low-oaked fruit entices in this food-friendly wine, elegant in lemon, lime and green apple. Juicy and well-rounded, it's an easily enjoyable wine at a fair price that will please a range of palates.

properties.title: Rooster Hill 2013 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
properties.description: Delicate whiffs of cardamom and clove lend alluring spice to this intensely apple-toned wine. While richly rounded, almost plump, in mouthfeel, it's dry in style with racy lemon-lime acidity.

properties.title: Acacia 2012 Thornton Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
properties.address: 555 Gateway Dr, Napa, CA 94558, USA
properties.description: Full bodied and bodacious, this is coyly suggestive at first in lemon and ripe pear. From the first come-hither notes, it's full steam ahead in vanilla and a huge expression of sweet oak.

properties.title: Anthony Road 2013 Gewurztraminer (Finger Lakes)
properties.address: 1020 Anthony Rd, Penn Yan, NY 14527, USA
properties.description: Musky rose petal and potpourri aromas perfume this elegant, full-bodied Gewürztraminer. It's not intensely concentrated on the palate, but fresh peach and tangerine flavors are brisk, bright and enjoyable.

properties.title: Rutherford Hill 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
properties.address: 200 Rutherford Hill Rd, Rutherford, CA 94573, USA
properties.description: Tart lemon and green apple make this a refreshing quaff, followed by creamy, weightier overtones of papaya and pear. Well-integrated and enjoyable, it has tannin presence and structure, finishing with a backbeat of fennel.

properties.title: Scott Family 2013 Dijon Clone Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)
properties.description: Seared pineapple and warm brioche aromas show strongly on this examination of one clone from the small but solid Monterey County appellation. Tropical elements of guava skin mix with sea salt and bright acidity on the refreshing palate.

properties.title: Trinity Vineyards 2013 Viognier (Washington)
properties.description: Sourced from Coyote Canyon in the Horse Heaven Hills, this wine offers aromas of honeysuckle and peach along with a light vanilla accent. It's full bodied and somewhat viscous in feel with abundant apricot flavors.

properties.title: Chateau Lafayette Reneau 2012 Owner's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Finger Lakes)
properties.address: 5081 NY-414, Hector, NY 14841, USA
properties.description: Smoked nuts and earth tones lend savoriness to ripe black-cherry and blackberry flavors. Subtle spice and licorice mark the midpalate, leading to a bold, grippy finish.

properties.title: St. Lucas 2006 Chardonnay (Mendoza)
properties.address: 3862 County Rd 150, Interlaken, NY 14847, USA
properties.description: Seems as though St. Lucas's white wines are more sturdy than its reds. This Chard is fleshy and won't last much longer, but for dense melon, peach and cider-like flavors and relatively good balance, it's making the grade. Plump and tropical on the finish as it battles to stay in line.

properties.title: Cantina del Taburno 2007 Amineo Coda di Volpe (Beneventano)
properties.description: This Coda di Volpe has a subdued nose that lets aromas of chopped herb and mineral reveal themselves slowly. It's tonic and firm with good crispness and an easy overall approach. A Marc de Grazia selection, various American importers.

properties.title: Mastroberardino 2007 White (Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio)
properties.description: Clean and crisp with mineral nuances backed by peach and passion fruit, this white Lacryma Christi has all the right qualities to pair with finger foods and salads. The wine is lightweight and lean but tonic and firm at the same time.

properties.title: Yangarra Estate Vineyard 2007 Single Vineyard Unoaked Chardonnay (McLaren Vale)
properties.address: 809 McLaren Flat Rd, Kangarilla SA 5157, Australia
properties.description: Streamlined and tart, this is a citrusy version of Chardonnay that showcases unadorned lemon and pineapple flavors.

properties.title: Susana Balbo 2005 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
properties.address: Cochabamba 7801, M5509, Mendoza, Argentina
properties.description: Expensive for what you're getting. The wine starts with a reddish-green set of aromas, which are backed by generic red-fruit flavors that are medium to narrow in scope and just don't taste much like Cabernet. Time allows it to show a bit more, but always it seems basic and shy.

properties.title: Feudo Arancio 2007 Grillo (Sicilia)
properties.description: This luminous, hay-colored Grillo imparts measured notes of banana and exotic fruit that add extra richness and dimension to what is a simple and easy-drinking white wine overall. You could pair this wine with a long list of seafood, vegetable and pasta recipes—and you can't beat this low price.

properties.title: Clos du Bois 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)
properties.description: Acidity marks this mouth watering wine. It's crisp and tart, providing balance to the slightly sweet flavors of pineapple and apricot jam. Good price for a Sauvignon Blanc of this popular style.

properties.title: Cosentino 2007 Pinot Grigio (Solano County)
properties.address: 7415 St Helena Hwy, Napa, CA 94558, USA
properties.description: An easy white wine that shows brisk acidity supporting well-ripened fruit flavors that are a little sweet. Pears, citrus fruits, green apples, figs, vanilla and white peppers flood the mouth, wrapped into a creamy, honeyed richness.

properties.title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2006 Indian Wells Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.address: 14111 NE 145th St, Woodinville, WA 98072, USA
properties.description: Consistent with previous bottlings, this is dark, oaky, lush with scents and flavors of butter, toast and roasted nuts. The fruit seems secondary to the parade of butterscotch, brown sugar and spice that comes walloping through the palate. The wine turns slightly bitter in the finish. This is a wine for those who love the California style of Chardonnay.

properties.title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.description: There's a nice, juicy, lip-smacking tang to this Sauv Blanc, like biting into a not quite ripe peach or a lemon drop. It's a good mix of citrus, steel and stone. A small amount of Sémillon in the blend adds weight to the midpalate.

properties.title: Columbia Crest 2006 Grand Estates Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.address: 178810 WA-221, Paterson, WA 99345, USA
properties.description: The Grand Estates Chardonnay from Columbia Crest is consistently the most broadly fruity, round and oaky wine in the lineup (outside of the much pricier reserve). Apple, pear and peach fruit dominates, and the sometimes too-present, tarted up flavors of butter and vanilla have been brought back into better proportion in this 2006 bottling. Sure to be a popular style, this is one of the best vintages in the past five years.

properties.title: Foxen 2005 Vogelzang Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)
properties.address: 7600 Foxen Canyon Rd, Santa Maria, CA 93454, USA
properties.description: A bit hot and indelicate, but very ripe, with currant jam and blackberry pie-filling flavors richly layered with smoky, caramelized oak. Finishes with warm-climate sweetness. From the warm, eastern part of Santa Ynez Valley known as Happy Canyon.

properties.title: Frei Brothers 2006 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
properties.description: Made in an immediately appealing, oaky way, this Chard has appealing peach, pear, green apple and honey flavors that taste like they were baked into a pie. Easy to find, with more than a million bottles in circulation.

properties.title: Tsillan Cellars 2006 Estate-Barrel Select Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.address: 3875 Hwy 97A, Chelan, WA 98816, USA
properties.description: Tart and sleek, this estate-grown fruit  has appealing elegance. The fruit is almost transparent, but not invisible, with very clean, high acid flavors of green berry, apple and pear. There is a layer of butterscotch that fills in the finish, without taking away from the finesse.

properties.title: Kiamie 2007 White Kuvée White (Paso Robles)
properties.description: A successful blend of Roussanne and Viognier that impresses for its complex swirl of fruits and spices, and maintains a clean, healthy balance. The peach, pineapple and honeysuckle flavors are enlivened with very crisp acidity that makes the wine finish clean and savory.

properties.title: Alta Vista 2006 Premium Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
properties.description: A little heavy and teetering toward overripeness, but it holds the line despite issuing aromas of raisin, heat, leather and marinated meat. The mouth is sweet and big-boned, with good tannic structure. Tastes a touch roasted and/or burnt on the finish. Gets it more right than wrong.

properties.title: Alta Vista 2007 Premium Torrontés (Salta)
properties.description: Lychee and melon aromas dance with sweeter scents of air freshener and perfume. The palate is zesty and driven, with narrow tangerine and orange flavors. Flashy Torrontes is what this is; it delivers the goods but doesn't step too hard on the gas pedal. Drink now.

properties.title: Cobblestone 2004 Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)
properties.description: Will it age? That's the question for this Cab, from a winery better known for Monterey Chardonnay. Right now it's a bit sharp and obvious, with ultra-ripe, jammy berry-cherry and chocolate flavors and firm tannins. But the balance seems to be there. If you don't want to cellar it, enjoy with barbecue.

properties.title: Cosentino 2004 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa County)
properties.address: 7415 St Helena Hwy, Napa, CA 94558, USA
properties.description: A little minty, with a clove and pepper edge to the black currant, carob and cedar flavors, but nice and dry, with a firm structure. Doesn't seem like an ager.

properties.title: Corvus 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
properties.description: Despite the cool, challenging vintage this 100% varietal wine shines through with notes of blackberry, cola, vanilla and cherry. The palate shows a pleasing mixture of tart fruit, grainy tannins and rich barrel flavors. It should only benefit from additional time in the bottle.

properties.title: Daou 2013 Reserve Chardonnay (Paso Robles)
properties.description: Nutty barrel smoke emerges first, then the fruits trend toward tropical, with pineapple and guava tones. Buttercream and salted caramel are laced throughout the palate, where vanilla ash flavors on the midpalate are balanced by bitter apple skins and Meyer lemon pith on the backend.

properties.title: Script 2011 Exordium Cabernet Sauvignon (Wahluke Slope)
properties.address: 2100 Denmark St, Sonoma, CA 95476, USA
properties.description: This 100% varietal wine from this new winery offers up notes of vanilla, herb, cocoa, cherry and woodspice. An elegant, palate-coating mouthfeel comes along with structured, dry tannins and tart acidity. An attractive wine that can be enjoyed now or held through 2020.

properties.title: Steven Kent 2013 Merrillie Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
properties.address: 5443 Tesla Rd, Livermore, CA 94550, USA
properties.description: Pure fruit aromas and delicious pear flavors give this an immediate appeal, but hints of butter and marzipan come out, too, adding complexity. It's medium bodied, dry but rounded in texture, and finishes with more fruit.

properties.title: Woodward Canyon 2013 Chardonnay (Washington)
properties.address: 11920 US-12, Lowden, WA 99360, USA
properties.description: For Washington whites 2013 was a challenging vintage, but you would never notice on this blend of Celilo (70%) and Woodward Canyon Estate vineyards. It's immediately attractive, with notes of mineral, lemon curd, spice, toast and pear. The style is creamy yet reserved, showing good depth of flavors and pleasing subtleties with the finish lingering.

properties.title: Ott & Murphy 2010 L'Entente Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.description: This blend of Syrah, Petite Sirah, Mourvèdre and Viognier offers intriguing aromas of blackberry and plum with woodspice accents. It's pleasingly fresh and pure with rich, focused fruit flavors that linger.

properties.title: Kunde 2013 Destination Series Sustainably Farmed and Estate Grown Viognier (Sonoma Valley)
properties.address: 9825 Sonoma Hwy, Kenwood, CA 95452, USA
properties.description: Briny, with a hint of salted caramel, this is a high-toned white wine, refreshing in lemon and pear notes, with a slight suggestion of orange peel that's entirely welcoming. Focused and crisp throughout, it remains vibrant amid a creaminess to the mouthfeel, finishing with the right balance of both.

properties.title: Kuentz-Bas 2013 Tradition Riesling (Alsace)
properties.description: The nose does not give much away but the dry palate is all about bright, luminous lemon zest and tart lemon juice. Have this on a hot summer day for ultimate refreshment.

properties.title: Le Cercle des Vignerons Saint-Louis 2014 Diamarine Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)
properties.description: Coteaux Varois is a small area in the heart of the Provence vineyards. This wine is fresh, fruity and light in texture. With its strawberry fruits, it has a crisp side and attractive acidity. The wine, with its fresh aftertaste, is ready to drink.

properties.title: Mas Gabinèle 2014 Grenache Gris (Vin de Pays de L'Herault)
properties.description: A light, dainty selection, this opens with soft scents of menthol and garrigue herbs that are framed by hints of pear and white melon rind. The palate is similarly light in intensity, with subtle fruit flavors that are complemented by touches of ginger and oaky spice. Drink now.

properties.title: Prominence 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
properties.address: 1032 Mt Veeder Rd, Napa, CA 94558, USA
properties.description: This is a smooth, thick and tannic wine that's full-bodied, robust and priced to sell. Cassis and blackberry both figure into the mix, along with a finish of tobacco and vanilla.

properties.title: Quintay 2014 Q Grand Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)
properties.description: Initially, this smells vegetal and sulfuric, a combination that's less than encouraging. On the palate, however, it comes around to show layering and depth. Green flavors of lime and bell pepper share space with oily lanolin notes, while a briny tasting finish adds complexity.

properties.title: Columbia Crest 2014 Reserve Chenin Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)
properties.description: Hailing from a single-vineyard block planted in 1979, this wine is aromatically reticent with notes of pear and flowers. It drinks off dry with stone- and tree-fruit flavors.

properties.title: Lone Birch 2013 Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)
properties.address: 560 Merlot Dr, Prosser, WA 99350, USA
properties.description: Pear, white flower and cantaloupe aromas lead to a rounded, creamy-feeling palate. It brings a lot of appeal and the balance is spot-on.

properties.title: Santa Alicia 2014 Reserva Espiritu de Los Andes Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
properties.description: Roasted berry aromas show notes of leather and earth. The palate is firm and tannic, with medicinal cherry and coffee flavors. A spicy finish remains after the fruit fades.

properties.title: Treleaven 2013 Reserve Gewurztraminer (Cayuga Lake)
properties.address: 658 Lake Rd, King Ferry, NY 13081, USA
properties.description: Luscious peach and floral notes contrast dusty, earthy mineral tones in this unusually composed Gewürztraminer. The palate is mouthfilling and expansive, but peachy fresh flavors add levity. It's a bold, full bodied wine but surprisingly balanced through the finish. Drink now.

properties.title: Provenance Vineyards 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
properties.description: Unctuous in mouthfeel, this white offers ripe peach, almost a peach cobbler, with a complement of vanilla. The bouquet is somewhat grassy and herbal, before an explosion of fruit and cream is delivered on the full-bodied palate.

properties.title: Château la Gordonne 2014 Vérité du Terroir Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
properties.description: While rich, this wine is well balanced with its fresh acidity and wild strawberry flavors. Citrus and a tangy orange texture are both attractive and give the wine a great lift. Drink now.

properties.title: Domaine La Borie Blanche 2012 Terroirs D'Altitude Red (Minervois La Liviniere)
properties.description: Anise, fennel seed and laurel lead the bouquet of this blend, framed by fruity tones of small red cherry and plum. Made from 70% Syrah, 20% Mourvèdre and 10% Grenache, the palate is easy and approachable, with a lightness to the body and tannins and a quick yet clean close.

properties.title: Yealands 2014 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)
properties.description: This is a very drinkable, plump wine probably best served as an apéritif. Hints of pear and honey mark the nose, while the palate blends in hints of allspice, cinnamon and clove. It tastes slightly off dry, but finishes with zesty acids that offer plenty of refreshment.

properties.title: Panthea 2012 Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)
properties.address: 2400 Guntly Rd, Philo, CA 95466, USA
properties.description: Aromas like fresh flowers and rosemary lead to lively citrus flavors and a dry balance that makes this wine more serious than many of its peers. Light to medium bodied and brisk with acidity, it's very thirst-quenching.

properties.title: Standing Sun 2013 Viognier (Santa Barbara County)
properties.address: 92 2nd St, Buellton, CA 93427, USA
properties.description: Oxidative aromas of macadamia nuts, walnut oil, marzipan and dried lemon are happily cut by a soda character on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers preserved lemons, seared marshmallow and nut oils, proving fairly fat on the sip.

properties.title: Swanson 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
properties.address: 1077 Dunaweal Ln, Calistoga, CA 94515, USA
properties.description: This youthful wine shows the exuberance of tannin and power of the vintage, finding its time to unwind. Small percentages of Merlot and Petit Verdot figure in the blend. Oak, cedar and herb jump out most, with faint layers of blackberry and black cherry.

properties.title: Red Newt Cellars 2013 Lahoma Vineyard The Knoll Riesling (Finger Lakes)
properties.description: Saffron and spice pepper fresh lemon and grapefruit aromas on this exceptionally sheer, savory dry Riesling. A haze of citrus flavors fall like gossamer on the palate, extended by layers of dusty minerals on the finish.

properties.title: Domaine Zinck 2015 Portrait Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
properties.address: 18 Rue des 3 Châteaux, 68420 Eguisheim, France
properties.description: Juicy, appetizing apple notes rise from the glass, helped along by summer blossom and rose. The off-dry palate is generous with ripe peach and plum accented by pleasantly bitter notes of pith. The tiniest amount of spritz helps to keep things fresh.

properties.title: Domaines Schlumberger 2013 Vendanges Tardives Cuvée Christine Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
properties.description: Lifted peach and wilting petals of Damask rose unite in the perfumed, supremely aromatic nose of this wine. The palate continues with rosewater notes of Turkish Delight and candied peach. Honeyed and rich, the sweet palate is concentrated but guided by lemony freshness. Overwhelming with perfume and concentration, this decadent wine needs either a perfumed, peachy dessert or a salty blue cheese to match those crashing waves of full-blown flavor.

properties.title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2014 DCV Estate Block 10 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
properties.description: This wine begins with intense oak and a voluptuous texture before settling into the crisp delicacy of bittersweet lemon and honeyed apple. Full bodied and nicely complex, it's a balanced expression of a cool vineyard site.

properties.title: Emile Beyer 2015 Tradition Riesling (Alsace)
properties.description: Lifted chamomile joins riper pear and apple fruit on the nose of this wine. On the concentrated palate these are joined by lemon and grapefruit zest in an unapologetically bracing style. This wine is clean, dry, fresh and totally lip-smacking with the full force of citrus behind it.

properties.title: Gérard Bertrand 2015 Château La Sauvageonne Volcanic Rosé (Coteaux du Languedoc)
properties.description: A blend of 50% Grenache, 30% Cinsault and 20% Syrah, this is a refreshing and well-balanced rosé. Though young and still somewhat tight right now, it offers bright notes of red cherry, strawberry hull and plum skin that are framed by hints of orange blossom, citrus peel and sweet spice. Silky in texture, with a mineral streak and ample acidity that results in a bright finish.

properties.title: Auclair 2013 Red Wine Heart of the Hill Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
properties.address: 18654 142nd Ave NE, Woodinville, WA 98072, USA
properties.description: Coming from the warm 2013 vintage, this wine is chock-full of dark fruit aromas and flavors, along with generous spice notes. It brings a lot of appeal, though it occasionally seems slightly dried out.

properties.title: B Cellars 2013 Star Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
properties.address: 703 Oakville Cross Rd, Napa, CA 94558, USA
properties.description: A charred, toasty oak imprint makes way for gunpowder, cedar and pencil in this lush, savory wine, complexly built with wrap-around tannins. Cedar and herb provide a classical component amidst black licorice and coffee.

properties.title: Boeckel 2015 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
properties.description: There is an earthy note amid the off-dry, gently peachy palate. The roundness is countered by zesty citrus pith that leaves a tangy, appetizing and moreish finish.

properties.title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2014 Herdade de São Miguel Alfrocheiro (Alentejano)
properties.address: Herdade da Pimenta - S. Miguel de Machede 7005 - 752, 7005-752 Évora, Portugal
properties.description: This Dão grape makes a firmly dry and tannic wine at this young stage. The hints of blackberry fruit and acidity promise a fine future of a rich wine with stylish, mineral-driven fruitiness. Drink this promising wine from 2018.

properties.title: Casa Larga 2014 Wild Ferment Riesling (Finger Lakes)
properties.address: 2287 Turk Hill Rd, Fairport, NY 14450, USA
properties.description: Subtle smoke notes accent tangerine, lemon and lime in this invigorating dry Riesling. Fermented via ambient yeast, its refinement and restrained elegance sets it apart from Casa Larga's other Rieslings. The finish is lingering yet fresh.

properties.title: Château Jolys 2014  Jurançon Sec
properties.description: Half-and-half Petit and Gros Manseng, this is a classic dry Jurançon blend. Soft and rich, it is a wine that is dry while demonstrating fine fresh fruitiness. The structure and strongly mineral texture both suggest the need for aging, so drink from 2018.

properties.title: Januik 2014 Cold Creek Vineyard Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.description: Bright aromas of pear, peach, baking spice and malolactic notes lead to a sleek yet creamy palate. It loses its rhythm a touch in the middle but comes back together.

properties.title: Joseph Cattin 2015 Riesling (Alsace)
properties.description: Soft citrus notes of clementine are streaked with fresh lemon to create this fresh, fruit-driven but very appetizing wine. The body is slender, dry and totally refreshing.

properties.title: Domaine Bernhard & Reibel 2013 Rittersberg Riesling (Alsace)
properties.description: A subdued nose has soft hints of baked apple and citrus. The palate of this wine brings in a bitter note of lemon pith on a dry, lithe body, made bright by lemon freshness. It finishes fresh and long.

properties.title: Domaine de la Tour Blanche 2014 Pinot Gris (Alsace)
properties.description: The scent of freshly cut green and red apple is followed by the spicy taste of burnt caramel and brought together with zesty citrus. The finish is dry and clean-cut.

properties.title: Domaine Gresser 2015 Kritt Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
properties.address: 2 Rue de l'École, 67140 Andlau, France
properties.description: Creamy earthiness joins the yellow stone fruit on nose and palate, making for a toned-down but full-fruited, generously rounded Gewurztraminer. The structure provided by pithy, pleasantly bitter notes leaves a lasting, refreshing impact.

properties.title: Domaine Pfister 2014 Tradition Riesling (Alsace)
properties.address: 53 Rue Principale, 67310 Dahlenheim, France
properties.description: Notes of stone and smoke join lemon and green apple on the nose of this wine. The palate has an earthier aspect but is bracingly fresh and precise with pure lemon zestiness. Dry and slender, the wine will round out with some bottle age. Drink 2018–2023.

properties.title: Domaine Schoffit 2014 Lieu Dit Harth Tradition Riesling (Alsace)
properties.description: An unusual edge of licorice clings to nose and palate of this fresh, zingy Riesling. The streamlined body is dry and pervaded by brisk, friendly lemon freshness.

properties.title: Flying Horse 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
properties.address: Angwin, CA 94508, USA
properties.description: Oak and ripe fruit combine to make this a Cabernet to drink now and over the next few years. It's softly tannic and frankly delicious, with blackberry, cherry, currant and sweet oak flavors.

properties.title: Andrea Felici 2012  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico
properties.description: Here's a delicious Verdicchio that opens with a floral fragrance of Spanish broom and stone fruit. The savory palate delivers creamy white peach, apple and lemon flavors alongside mineral and saline accents. The finish boasts an almond note. Hold for two or three years to develop complexity. Peter/Warren Selections, Augustan Wine Imports.

properties.title: Apex 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.description: Fermented and aged in stainless steel, this 100% varietal wine is bright and focused with notes of herbs, citrus and kiwi. It's ripe and full of juicy fruit flavors with a spine of citric acidity running throughout. Give this some time to open up.

properties.title: Basalt 2012 Double River Ranch Estate Semillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
properties.address: 906 Port Dr, Clarkston, WA 99403, USA
properties.description: This is a very stylish and elegant Sémillon, estate-grown and offering tongue-coating, smooth flavors of lemon, lime and dusty, dry honeycomb. Lightly dappled with cinnamon spice, it's an outstanding example of this often-overlooked grape.

properties.title: Bergevin Lane 2012 Love-Struck Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.address: 70 N Colville St #106, Walla Walla, WA 99362, USA
properties.description: The 8% splash of Roussanne in this blend, contributes to the lovely complexity of the opening aromas. Sweet citrus, honey and tea flavors combine, while keeping the palate light and focused. Complex hints of lemon meringue, vanilla cream and toasted coconut keep it lively and interesting through to the finish.

properties.title: Hubert Meyer 2011 Winzenberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)
properties.description: Not quite dry, this is an impressively rich wine. It has a strong mineral element that brings out the currant flavors and intense acidity. This is a wine that is still developing, offering an impressive array of flavors while still needing time. Drink from 2015.

properties.title: Kiona 2010 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
properties.address: 44612 N Sunset Rd, Benton City, WA 99320, USA
properties.description: Principally sourced from the winery's oldest block of Cabernet Sauvignon, this offers a solid core of dense black cherry and cassis fruit. There's a streak of cola and sassafras, and the wine seems to lighten up as it sails into the finish. The blend includes 10% Cabernet Franc and 5% Petit Verdot.

properties.title: Rodney Strong 2010 Brothers Ridge Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
properties.description: This wine is 100% Cabernet, sourced from one of the winery's vineyards in a warm part of Alexander Valley. It's quite ripe, with flavors of cherry pie, red plum, currants, tobacco, cola and new French oak. The tannins are lush and soft, but the wine will develop for many years. Drink now–2020, at least.

properties.title: Tenuta Cocci Grifoni 2012 Colle Vecchio  (Offida Pecorino)
properties.description: From the estate that saved the Pecorino grape from extinction, this focused and refined wine intrigues from the start, with its floral aromas of jasmine and acacia, layered with whiffs of balsamic herbs. The palate demonstrates lovely energy and elegance, with peach and tropical fruit flavors accented by mineral and almond.

properties.title: Bouchard Finlayson 2009 Crocodile's Lair Kaaimansgat Chardonnay (Overberg)
properties.address: R320, Hermanus, 7200, South Africa
properties.description: This leads with oak-derived aromas of sweet smoke, toast, vanilla and baking spice, immediately followed by notes of lemon custard, melon and pear flesh. The mouthfeel is round and full, but zippy acidity rescues the finish from feeling flat or overdone. An attractive toasted hazelnut flavor lingers well through the finish.

properties.title: Katherine Goldschmidt 2011 Crazy Creek Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
properties.description: All the parts are here to make a good Cabernet. Flavors of chocolate, blackberry jam, cassis and smoky oak are framed in rich tannins. But the wine needs a little time to knit together. Should be drinking well by spring 2014. It's a great value for the price, and easy to find with more than 15,000 cases produced.

properties.title: La Staffa 2012  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico
properties.address: 403 Derby Ave, Orange, CT 06477, USA
properties.description: Here's a quintessential Verdicchio from one of the denomination's rising stars that opens with a fragrance of spring flowers, hay and flint. The palate delivers fleshy white peach, pear and almond flavors, along with mineral notes and bright acidity that results in a refreshing finish. Fun to drink now or hold 2–3 years for additional complexity.

properties.title: Marotti Campi 2010 Riserva Salmariano  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
properties.description: This lovely Verdicchio has the wine's trademark floral fragrance of broom and acacia flowers, along with a whiff of beeswax. The rich palate boasts creamy apple, yellow peach and tropical fruit flavors accompanied by energizing mineral notes and crisp acidity.

properties.title: Chatom Vineyards 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Calaveras County)
properties.description: A light golden SB from Calaveras County with tons of tropical aromas, predominantly pineapple, that follow into the taste, which veers disproportionately sweet, with not enough acidity to balance it out.

properties.title: Colacino 2009 Quarto White (Calabria)
properties.description: Here's a thin and lightweight expression from Calabria (the “toe of the boot of Italy”) that offers delicate tones of white flower and peach blossom backed by fresh crispness and zest. It's a very easygoing and informal wine overall.

properties.title: Geyser Peak 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
properties.address: 2306 Magnolia Dr, Healdsburg, CA 95448, USA
properties.description: Soft and herbal, with modest cherry and oak flavors. A simple, dry wine to wash down everyday fare.

properties.title: Hawkstone 2009 Barney's Heritage Cuvee Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
properties.description: A decent Chardonnay, but it's pretty sweet and simple, with the taste of sugared pineapple and orange tea. Oak and alcohol of course make it more wine-like.

properties.title: La Casa Dell'Orco 2009 Falanghina (Beneventano)
properties.description: This is an easy, no-fuss expression of Falanghina that opens with direct aromas of citrus and stone fruit and follows through to the palate with a tonic, refreshing feel. It would work with fried vegetable appetizers or light lunches.

properties.title: Loomis 2009 Air Rosé (Napa Valley)
properties.address: 4060 Ridge Dr, Loomis, CA 95650, USA
properties.description: Bone dry and very acidic, almost sour, with watery flavors of orange and lemon cough drop candy. Gains a few points for elegance and cleanliness.

properties.title: Rock Wall 2009 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
properties.address: 2301 Monarch St, Alameda, CA 94501, USA
properties.description: A sugary Chardonnay whose main attraction is its honey flavor. That gives a dessert wine sweetness to the pineapple and lemon fruit. Ready now.

properties.title: Roth 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
properties.description: Sweet, soft and candied, with black cherry and raspberry jam, Dr. Pepper cola and cedar flavors. Seems pricey for what you get.

properties.title: Terra dei Re 2009 Claris  (Fiano di Avellino)
properties.description: This Fiano is a bit flat in the mouth and offers aromas of pressed yellow rose, butterscotch and sun-dried apricot. The wine is correct, albeit one dimensional.

properties.title: Terra Valentine 2009 Riesling (Spring Mountain District)
properties.description: Starts with strong, assaultive wildflower, dried apricot, butterscotch and sautéed banana aromas, then turns dry and acidic in the mouth. A difficult wine to like.

properties.title: Umberto Cesari 2009 Moma White (Rubicone)
properties.description: Here's a cheerful, no-fuss white blend from central Italy (with Trebbiano, Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc grapes) that would pair with informal rice or pasta salad. Citrus, floral and peach flavors wash over the palate.

properties.title: Loomis 2008 Ember Red (Napa Valley)
properties.description: Dry and simple, with pleasant herb, raspberry tea and spice flavors. A little soft and sweet, but okay for everyday fare.

properties.title: Bargetto 2008 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
properties.description: Heavy handed in ripe fruit and oak, with a soft, sweet mouthfeel. Will appeal to fans of the tropical fruit and buttered toast style of Chardonnay.

properties.title: Domaine Gresser 2013 Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)
properties.description: Aromatic notes of green, yellow and red-cheeked apples waft enticingly from the glass. The palate is equally friendly and smile-inducing, with a totally fruit-driven but exuberant character that majors on frivolous pleasure. The palate is light, frothy and dry. This is made for sparkly afternoons and evenings that last and last. Be sure to get more than one bottle.

properties.title: Cuvaison 2014 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Carneros)
properties.description: With an alluring bouquet of fresh-cut jasmine and citrus, this is a light, vibrant wine, bristling in acidity that's fruity and briny in equal measure. Clean, crisp and fermented in stainless steel, it offers everything one wants in a refreshing quaff.

properties.title: District 7 Wines 2012 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Monterey County)
properties.address: 502 E 560th Rd, Walnut Grove, MO 65770, USA
properties.description: This bottling by the Scheid family of wines is a solidly reliable deal, with dried black cherries, beef jerky, leather and a bit of tar on the nose. Crushed, dried herbs show on the palate, along with roasted pork and more black cherry, proving both juicy and meaty, with a slate-driven minerality.

properties.title: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2012 Brut Zero Dosage Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)
properties.description: Freshly sliced green and yellow apples are the aromatic markers of this dry, softly fizzing crémant. There is substance and body from yeasty autolysis that comes across as the golden crust of wheat bread, with the apples always peeping through. An elegant apéritif without dosage and all the purity of ripe, delicious fruit.

properties.title: Quivira 2014 Fig Tree Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
properties.address: 4900 W Dry Creek Rd, Healdsburg, CA 95448, USA
properties.description: Light with a floral, jasmine-like bouquet, this perennial classic shows lemony crispness around a medium-bodied core of juicy acidity and weight, remaining balanced and fresh. On the finish, expect a length and depth of fig flavor.

properties.title: Terra d'Oro 2014 Chenin Blanc-Viognier (Clarksburg)
properties.address: 20680 Shenandoah School Rd, Plymouth, CA 95669, USA
properties.description: This dry, light-bodied wine smells vivid and fresh, like sliced peaches and canteloupe. It tastes equally fruity and ripe, backed by good acidity to keep it mouthwatering. Notable richness in the texture helps the flavors linger on the finish.

properties.title: Andreola 2014 Ma's de Fer Rive di Soligo Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)
properties.description: Creamy and crisp, this opens with aromas of peach and fragrant wild flowers. On the palate, a hint of chopped herbs adds depth to apple, pear and citrus while vibrant acidity and a soft mousse provide the framework. A mineral note accents the finish.

properties.title: Bortolomiol 2014 Bandarossa 40th Anniversary Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)
properties.description: Aromas of wisteria, white stone fruit and a hint of acacia lead the way. The crisp, quenching palate delivers yellow apple, juicy pear and a hint of mineral alongside firm acidity and a persistent perlage.

properties.title: Villa Sandi 2014 Cartizze Vigna La Rivetta  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)
properties.description: This creamy, fragrant wine seamlessly combines the rich fruit typical of Cartizze with the drier Brut style. It opens with heady scents of jasmine, wisteria, exotic fruit and green apple while the creamy palate offers juicy peach, thyme and citrus zest alongside a foamy mousse. It closes crisp and clean.

properties.title: Weixelbaum 2013 Wahre Werte Auslese Sauvignon Blanc (Niederösterreich)
properties.description: Rich glints of ripe passion fruit are burgeoning on the nose. The palate has the same richness but is kept in check by wonderfully insisting, bright lemon acidity that suggests both peel and flesh. This is not really fully sweet and thus occupies an uncertain field—one which clever and innovative cooks navigate with aplomb. This is a wine for spiced, exotic dishes that involve fruit, for soft, ripe cheeses or savory fruit combos. The wine's creamy finish pulls all the elements together.

properties.title: Bisol 2014 Cartizze Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)
properties.description: Aromas of tropical fruit, spring flowers and white peach lead the nose on this single-vineyard bottling. The rich palate doles out green apple, ripe pear and candied citrus zest alongside racy acidity and a foaming mousse.

properties.title: Argiolas 2012 S'elegas  (Nuragus di Cagliari)
properties.description: Made from Sardinia's native Nuragus grape, S'elegas offers an enticing fragrance of yellow flowers, stone fruit and citrus. The delicious palate has rich flavors of peach and creamy lemon uplifted by fresh acidity.

properties.title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.address: 14111 NE 145th St, Woodinville, WA 98072, USA
properties.description: This Cabernet Sauvignon blend includes Merlot, Syrah and a small amount of “other,” yielding a well-rounded, ripe wine with lush flavors of blueberry and blackberry. The tangy acids spark a finish of fresh herb, licorice and tobacco.

properties.title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2011 Indian Wells Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.description: The popular Indian Wells bottling from Chateau Ste. Michelle includes 10% Syrah, sourced from the Wahluke Slope. The combination is a proven winner. This medium-bodied, fruit-forward wine's inviting raspberry and cherry flavors are anchored with well-structured tannins.

properties.title: Domaine Pichot 2009 Les Larmes de Bacchus  (Vouvray)
properties.description: Wood aging does not help the richness of this wine. It brings out toast and covers the glorious sweet fruits. With acidity thrown in the balance is not there. Maybe several years will help, so don't drink before 2017.

properties.title: Les Vins de Vienne 2010 La Sillote Red (Vacqueyras)
properties.description: Despite being labeled at 15% abv, this is a crisp rendering of Vacqueyras, filled with fresh herbal notes and tart, crunchy cherries. A violet-like essence emerges on the palate, providing added interest. It does turn a bit astringent on the finish, so drink it from 2015–2020, or now with some suitably rare beef or lamb.

properties.title: Domaine des Cantarelles 2012 Rosé de Fayel Rosé (Vin de Pays du Gard)
properties.address: Quartier Cantarelle, 83119 Brue-Auriac, France
properties.description: Importer Robert Kacher has an impressive stable of rosés from the southern Rhône at terrific pricing. this one, from the undervalued right bank of the valley, features 70% Cabernet Franc. Peaches, cherries and hints of peppery spice combine easily, then end on a note of wet stones. Drink now.

properties.title: Les Trois Couronnes 2011  Gigondas
properties.description: This wine teeters between superripe (bold black cherries) and overripe (raisined and browning black cherries) on the nose, but comes out very good in the end. It's full bodied and richly textured, with pretty notes of lavender and thyme accenting black cherry flavors and a long velvety finish. Drink it over the next several months.

properties.title: Legaris 2012 Verdejo (Rueda)
properties.description: While not a mind-blower, this fresh Verdejo is all that it should be. The nose offers a just-right blend of minerally crispness along with apple, melon and citrus aromas. The palate is properly tangy, while flavors of orange and melon finish solid and zesty.

properties.title: Maisonry 2012 Hudson Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
properties.description: The vineyard is in the Carneros district, which makes you wonder why the winery doesn't so identify it. The wine shows brisk, mouthwatering acidity and flavors that range from ripe tropical fruits through lemons and grapefruits to tart gooseberries.

properties.title: Shannon Ridge 2012 High Elevation Collection Chardonnay (Lake County)
properties.description: Well-priced from estate-grown vineyards, Shannon Ridge's Chardonnay is smooth in lemon, ripe apple and pear, and easygoing and clean with a finish of pineapple and vanilla oak. A great go-to wine for white wine lovers.

properties.title: Tangent 2012 Paragon Vineyard Viognier (Edna Valley)
properties.address: 5828 Orcutt Rd, San Luis Obispo, CA 93401, USA
properties.description: Any poultry or veal entrée that's slightly sweet and spicy will love this Viognier. Entirely unoaked so that only the fruit stars, it features powerful flavors of Asian pears, tangerines, green apples and honeysuckle, brightened with a squeeze of lime acidity. Although it will pair with a huge range of foods, General Tso's Chicken comes to mind as ideal.

properties.title: Ancestry 2012 Reminiscence Riesling (Columbia Gorge (WA))
properties.address: 13590 NE Village Square Dr #1035, Woodinville, WA 98072, USA
properties.description: Hailing from Underwood Mountain, this is cool climate Riesling made in a warm vintage with notes of lime, guava and mineral. It has a healthy amount of residual sugar (37 g/L) but the acid (8.4g/L) creates a pleasing sense of tension and makes it seemingly drier.

properties.title: Avennia 2012 Oliane Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)
properties.description: Two thirds Boushey Vineyard, and one third Red Willow, this pure Sauvignon Blanc has not yet completely knit itself together. There's a solid core of clean and tangy ripe lemon, citrus and pineapple fruit. The finish is where it lacks some focus, and may benefit from another year or two of bottle age.

properties.title: Balletto 2012 Teresa's Unoaked Estate Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
properties.address: 5700 Occidental Rd, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
properties.description: Taste this wine blind, and you'd never guess it was unoaked. It has delicious and savory notes of buttered toast and vanilla. The wine is huge in tangerines, golden mangoes, Meyer lemons and ripe peaches, brightened with crisp acidity.

properties.title: Dopff Au Moulin 2015 The Furst Vorbourg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)
properties.address: 2 Av. Jacques Preiss, 68340 Riquewihr, France
properties.description: The nose is shy and merely hints at lemon zestiness. The palate also opens with lemon zest but in a very concentrated full-on fashion with a citrus blast. There is a softer touch of orange and tangerine, too. The freshness is bundled and has ample drive and energy. This certainly is juicy, citrus fresh and off dry. The finish is whistle-clean and very refreshing.

properties.title: Gini 2011 Col Foscarin  (Recioto di Soave Classico)
properties.description: Made with dried Garganega grapes, this opens with heady aromas of passion fruit, dried nectarine slices and candied lemon. Concentrated and juicy, the delicious palate doles out peach jam, acacia honey and pastry alongside bright acidity that adds freshness.

properties.title: King Estate 2016 Domaine Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
properties.address: 80854 Territorial Hwy, Eugene, OR 97405, USA
properties.description: Sophisticated and complex, this brings well-structured layers of citrus juice, flesh and rind. It offers a delicate herbal touch and a lingering finish. As the wine evolves in the glass, a tasty hint of honeysuckle emerges.

properties.title: Le Mulet Rouge 2016 Estate Viognier (Fiddletown)
properties.description: Concentrated and rich in flavor and creamy in texture, this wine has a big profile without seeming overtly fruity or oaky. The mouthfeel is lush, broad and quietly powerful, while subtle pear and marzipan flavors coat the palate and linger on the finish. It makes a grand impression and is “meaty” enough to serve with poultry or even beef. Winemaker Tracy Hart used no oak or stainless steel, fermenting and aging the wine in food-grade polyethylene FlexTanks.

properties.title: Malat 2013 Brut Reserve Sparkling (Niederösterreich)
properties.description: A touch of ripe yellow apple plays on the nose and carries appetizingly onto the palate. The body is light, adding a lemony streak of freshness to the apple fruit while creamy fizz disperses these flavors across the wine. Subtle autolytic notes suggest lemony sponge cake. It finishes dry.

properties.title: Margerum 2016 M5 White (Santa Barbara County)
properties.description: This blend of 48% Grenache Blanc, 14% Roussanne, 14% Viognier, 12% Marsanne and 12% Vermentino is one of the best and zippiest white Rhône-inspired blends on the market right now. Its clean nose offers key lime, grapefruit pith and gunpowder tea aromas. The palate is grippy and fresh, with zesty lime skin and the slight bubblegum flavors.

properties.title: Nino Franco 2016  Prosecco Superiore di Cartizze
properties.description: Creamy and delicious, this elegant off-dry sparkler doles out layers of sweet white peach, yellow apple, pear and a tangy note of candied lemon drop. A silky perlage gives it a smooth polished texture while bright acidity lifts the rich flavors.

properties.title: Raymond 2014 Reserve Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
properties.description: Dusty and tannic, this is a solid value for its quality—a wine of freshness and grip that offers complexity and approachability in equal measure. Black-cherry and black -pepper flavors highlight the palate.

properties.title: Boeckel 2014 Extra Brut Chardonnay Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)
properties.description: Scented mellow notes of ripe yellow apple stream from the glass. On the palate they are displayed against an autolytic background that recalls both rye bread and short-crust pastry. The mouse is very fine and adds creamy allure to the dry light palate. This is dry, classy and rather sophisticated with a refreshing finish that leaves a lasting impression.

properties.title: Chateau Montelena 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
properties.description: Softened by the addition of 13% Merlot and 1% Cabernet Franc, this wine leads with smoky oak and baked bread aromas, followed by cassis and mocha notes. Medium bodied, with a seamless texture, it adds baked cherry, cedar and tomato leaf components with measured richness.

properties.title: Claiborne & Churchill 2016 Dry Riesling (Edna Valley)
properties.address: 74 Claiborne Wy, Starkville, MS 39759, USA
properties.description: The nose of this bottling is all about bright citrus and yellow flower, with upfront aromas suggesting crushed white rocks, grapefruit pith and sweet grass. It's supercrisp, grippy and sharp in acidity on the palate, showing white flower and clover honey flavors as it opens.

properties.title: Domaine de la Tour Blanche 2015 Schoenenbourg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)
properties.description: Blossom and citrus inform the nose—white jasmine hovers alongside grapefruit and orange. The palate is juicy and full of bouncy easy fruit on a fluid dryish body.
